sentences.sContent: “What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, but what happens in California makes the world go round,” says a narrator.
sentences.sContent_eng: “What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, but what happens in California makes the world go round,” says a narrator.
sentences.sCn: 一个解说员说道：“维加斯发生的事就在维加斯，但是加州发生了什么全世界都知道了。”

sentences.sContent: “I can never look now at the Milky Way”, said the narrator in “The Sentinel”, “without wondering from which of those banked clouds of stars the emissaries are coming.
sentences.sContent_eng: “I can never look now at the Milky Way”, said the narrator in “The Sentinel”, “without wondering from which of those banked clouds of stars the emissaries are coming.
sentences.sCn: “现在，我再也看不到银河了。” 在《哨兵》中，他借叙述者的口说道，“没错，那层层叠叠的星云中，我们期待的使者正在向这里赶来。

sentences.sContent: In Benjamin the important thing, as I think we've said, is the idea that the narrator is the apparatus.
sentences.sContent_eng: In Benjamin the important thing, as I think we've said, is the idea that the narrator is the apparatus.
sentences.sCn: 本杰明的这个作品，很重要的一点，我觉得我们已经说过了，就是叙述者是机器。

words.tran: 叙事的，叙述的；叙事体的

trans.tranOther: the person who tells the story in a book or a play
